```{r}
# ---------------------------------------------
# Creating a Hypothetical Population Dataset
# ---------------------------------------------
set.seed(123)

N <- 500  # Population size

# Population: Student IDs and exam marks
population <- data.frame(
  StudentID = 1:N,
  Marks = rnorm(N, mean = 70, sd = 10)  # Normally distributed marks
)

# ---------------------------------------------
# Simple Random Sampling Without Replacement
# ---------------------------------------------
n <- 50  # Sample size

sample_wor <- population[sample(1:N, n, replace = FALSE), ]

# ---------------------------------------------
# Simple Random Sampling With Replacement
# ---------------------------------------------
sample_wr <- population[sample(1:N, n, replace = TRUE), ]

# ---------------------------------------------
# Comparing the Two Samples
# ---------------------------------------------
mean_wor <- mean(sample_wor$Marks)
mean_wr  <- mean(sample_wr$Marks)

var_wor  <- var(sample_wor$Marks)
var_wr   <- var(sample_wr$Marks)

cat("Population Mean:", mean(population$Marks), "\n\n")

cat("SRSWOR Mean:", mean_wor, "\n")
cat("SRSWR Mean:", mean_wr, "\n\n")

cat("SRSWOR Variance:", var_wor, "\n")
cat("SRSWR Variance:", var_wr, "\n")

```
